place.name: FULSTOW
place.gazetteerText: FULSTOW, a parish in Louth district, Lincoln; adjacent to the East Lincoln railway, near Ludborough r. station, 7¼ miles N of Louth. Post town, Ludborough, under Louth. Acres, 2, 840. Real property, £4, 560. Pop., 577. Houses, 133. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £159. Patron, H. R. Allenby, Esq. The church is ancient. There are chapels for Wesleyans, Primitive Methodists, and United Free Methodists. Charities, £19. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
